meanings.definition: Overwhelmed or obsessed with a desire to be on stage or in the spotlight.
meanings.sent1: The stagestruck actor eagerly awaited their turn to perform in the play.
meanings.sent2: She was so stagestruck that she practiced her lines every day in front of the mirror.
meanings.sent3: The stagestruck cat kept jumping onto the table, seeking attention like a little performer.
meanings.sent4: His stagestruck enthusiasm lit up the room, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The stagestruck student's eyes sparkled with excitement as they rehearsed for the school play.

meanings.definition: Affected or captivated by the theater or acting.
meanings.sent1: The stagestruck audience applauded loudly at the end of the play.
meanings.sent2: She had a stagestruck look in her eyes as she watched the actors on stage.
meanings.sent3: The stagestruck child begged their parents to take them to see another play.
meanings.sent4: His stagestruck fascination with theater grew stronger with each performance he attended.
meanings.sent5: The stagestruck fan collected posters and memorabilia from all the shows they had seen.
